channel.title: Blog on Anthea
channel.description: Recent content in Blog on Anthea

item.title: Why Anthea Starts with Seedlings
item.description:
Seedlings are the most fragile — and most decisive — stage in a plant’s life.

In Anthea, we start from seedlings because this is where biology, environment, and genetics first meet.

More coming soon.

item.title: Beyond Patents: Building a Shared Seed Commons for Urban Agriculture
item.description: Exploring how open-source seeds are reviving the ancient tradition of seed sharing to build resilience in modern urban food systems.

item.title: The Seed Revolution: How Open-Source Genetics Unlock Vertical Farming's Potential
item.description: Discover how open-source seeds are breaking proprietary locks to create a more resilient and adaptable future for vertical farming.
